best_practices: Use semantic HTML structure before applying classes. Tailwind works best when paired with meaningful HTML elements.
Leverage breakpoints systematically. Start mobile-first with base classes, then add sm:, md:, lg:, and xl: prefixes for larger screens.
Extract repetitive patterns into components. If you use the same class combination multiple times, consider creating a reusable component.
anti_patterns: Avoid excessive nesting of utility classes. If a div has more than 10 classes, consider whether it should be split or extracted.
Do not use arbitrary values when a built-in Tailwind class exists. Check the docs before using square bracket notation like [25px].
Avoid coupling styles too tightly to content. Use flexible utilities like flex and grid rather than fixed widths when layouts should adapt.

faq.question: How do I add custom colors to Tailwind?
faq.answer: Add a colors section to your tailwind.config.js. Define your palette with descriptive names, then use them like any built-in color: bg-primary, text-secondary, border-accent.

faq.question: Can Tailwind be used with CSS-in-JS libraries?
faq.answer: Yes. Tailwind works with any framework. For styled-components or emotion, use the @tailwindcss/styled-components plugin or apply classes via the style prop.

faq.question: How do I purge unused styles in production?
faq.answer: Tailwind v3+ automatically purges unused styles in production builds. Ensure your content paths in tailwind.config.js include all template files.

faq.question: What is the difference between container and mx-auto?
faq.answer: container centers your content with max-width constraints at each breakpoint. mx-auto adds horizontal margin auto. Use container for page layout, mx-auto for centering individual elements within a larger container.

faq.question: How do I create a loading spinner with Tailwind?
faq.answer: Use border utilities with animate-spin or animate-pulse. Example: div class="border-4 border-gray-300 border-t-blue-500 rounded-full w-8 h-8 animate-spin" creates a standard loading spinner.

faq.question: Can I use Tailwind for print styles?
faq.answer: Yes, use the print: modifier. Example: class="print:hidden" hides an element when printing. You can customize print behavior just like dark mode.
